description:
This module provides functions to handle image manipulations like resizing, zooming, special effects etc.

The errors raised by functions of this module have the namespace http://zorba.io/modules/image/error (associated with prefix ierr).

functions.name: add-noise
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $noise-type as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary
functions.description:
Add noise to an image.

Allowed noise types are:

  • UniformNoise
  • GaussianNoise
  • MultiplicativeGaussianNoise
  • ImpulseNoise
  • LaplaceianNoise
  • PoissonNoise
functions.summary: Add noise to an image.

parameters.name: noise-type
parameters.description: specifies the type of noise to add

returns.description: A copy of $image with added noise

functions.description: Blur an image.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description: is the radius of the Gaussian in pixels.

parameters.name: sigma

functions.name: overlay
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $overlay-image as xs:base64Binary, $overlay-upper-left-x as xs:unsignedInt, $overlay-upper-left-y as xs:unsignedInt, $operator as xs:string) as xs:base64Binary
functions.description:
Overlay $image with $overlay-image at the specfied position.

The $operator defines the details of the overlay and can have one of the following values:

  • OverCompositeOp: The result is the union of the two image shapes with the overlay image obscuring image in the region of overlap.
  • InCompositeOp: The result is a simple overlay image cut by the shape of image. None of the image data of image is included in the result.
  • OutCompositeOp: The resulting image is the overlay image with the shape of image cut out.
  • AtopCompositeOp: The result is the same shape as image, with overlay image obscuring image there the image shapes overlap. Note that this differs from OverCompositeOp because the portion of composite image outside of image's shape does not appear in the result.
  • XorCompositeOp: The result is the image data from both overlay image and image that is outside the overlap region. The overlap region will be blank.
  • PlusCompositeOp: The result is just the sum of the image data of both images. Output values are cropped to 255 (no overflow). This operation is independent of the matte channels.
  • MinusCompositeOp: The result of overlay image - image, with overflow cropped to zero. The matte chanel is ignored (set to 255, full coverage).
  • AddCompositeOp: The result of overlay image + image, with overflow wrapping around (mod 256).
  • SubtractCompositeOp: The result of overlay image - image, with underflow wrapping around (mod 256). The add and subtract operators can be used to perform reverible transformations.
  • DifferenceCompositeOp: The result of abs(overlay image - image). This is useful for comparing two very similar images.
  • BumpmapCompositeOp: The result image shaded by overlay image.
functions.summary: Overlay $image with $overlay-image at the specfied position.

parameters.name: overlay-upper-left-x
parameters.description: horizontal position within $image where the left upper edge of the $overlay-image is placed

parameters.name: overlay-upper-left-y
parameters.description: vertical position within $image where the left upper edge of the $overlay-image is placed

parameters.name: operator
parameters.description: defines how the overlay image should be overlayed (see details in operator listing above)

returns.description: A new image consisting of $image overlayed with $overlay-image.

functions.name: resize
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $width as xs:unsignedInt, $height as xs:unsignedInt) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Get a copy of the passed image with changed width and height (without zooming the image's content).

To change the size of the actual contents of an image, use the zoom function.

More in detail: If the new dimensions are greater than the current dimensions the new image will have the passed image in the upper left corner and the rest will be filled with the current background color.

If the passed dimensions are less than the current dimensions, the new image will contain the specified rectangle of the passed image beginning at the upper left corner.
functions.summary: Get a copy of the passed image with changed width and height (without zooming the image's content).

returns.description: resized copy of the source image

functions.name: rotate
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $angle as xs:int) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Get a new image as rotated copy of a passed source image (rotated by -360 to 360 degrees).

The image is enlarged if this is required for containing the rotated image, but never shrunk even if the rotation would make a smaller image possible.
functions.summary: Get a new image as rotated copy of a passed source image (rotated by -360 to 360 degrees).

parameters.name: angle
parameters.description: between -360 to 360 degrees. Other values will be adjusted by modulo 360

functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $factor as xs:double) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description: Apply a solarize effect to the image (similar to the effect seen when exposing a photographic film to light during the development process).
functions.summary: Apply a solarize effect to the image (similar to the effect seen when exposing a photographic film to light during the development process).

parameters.name: factor
parameters.description: strength of the solarization (0 to 65535; 65535=100%)

functions.name: stereo
functions.signature: ($left-image as xs:base64Binary, $right-image as xs:base64Binary) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Make two passed images appear as stereo image when viewed with red-blue glasses.

Both images should be same but from a slightly different angle for this to work.

Both images should have the same size, if not, the size of the left image will be taken.
functions.summary: Make two passed images appear as stereo image when viewed with red-blue glasses.

parameters.name: left-image
parameters.description: left image for the stereo image.

parameters.name: right-image
parameters.description: right image for the stereo image.

returns.description: A new image as combined stereo image of both source images

errors: <xqdoc:error xmlns:xqdoc="http://www.xqdoc.org/1.0">ierr:IM001 one of the passed images is invalid</xqdoc:error>

functions.name: sub-image
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $left-upper-x as xs:unsignedInt, $left-upper-y as xs:unsignedInt, $width as xs:unsignedInt, $height as xs:unsignedInt) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Copy a part of the source image specified by a rectangle.

If the passed parameters for the sub-image specify a rectangle that isn't entirely within the source image only the area that lies within the image boundaries will be returned.
functions.summary: Copy a part of the source image specified by a rectangle.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: the image from which to extract a sub-image

parameters.name: left-upper-x
parameters.description: is the x value of the upper left corner of the rectangle to cut out

parameters.name: left-upper-y
parameters.description: is the y value of the upper left corner of the rectangle to cut out.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: width of the rectangle to cut out

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: height of the rectangle to cut out

returns.description: A new image containing parts of the source image

functions.name: zoom-by-height
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $height as xs:unsignedInt) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Zoom the passed image to a given new height while keeping the ratio between width and height.

So, the width is scaled accordingly.

Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. basic:width will not show a different value).
functions.summary: Zoom the passed image to a given new height while keeping the ratio between width and height.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: new height for the image in pixels

returns.description: A copy of $image with given $height and width adjusted accordingly

functions.name: zoom-by-width
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $width as xs:unsignedInt) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Zoom the passed image to a given new width while keeping the ratio between width and height.

So, the height is scaled accordingly.

Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. basic:width will not show a different value).
functions.summary: Zoom the passed image to a given new width while keeping the ratio between width and height.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: new width for the image in pixels

returns.description: A copy of $image with given $width and height changed accordingly

functions.name: zoom
functions.signature: ($image as xs:base64Binary, $ratio as xs:double) as xs:base64Binary external
functions.description:
Zoom the passed image by the specified factor while keeping the ratio between width and height.

A ratio of less than 1 will make the image smaller.

A ratio of less or equal than 0 will not effect the image.

Important note: this function does not change the size information stored in the image (e.g. basic:width will not show a different value).
functions.summary: Zoom the passed image by the specified factor while keeping the ratio between width and height.

parameters.name: ratio
parameters.description: ratio to zoom width and height by

returns.description: A copy of $image with resized content
